jobs.title: Head of Marketing
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Role Overview

Anagram is a holding company that builds, consults, and invests in the crypto industry. We believe in deploying a combination of human and financial capital to innovate and create value.

We’re looking for a passionate and data-driven Head of Marketing to help shape our online presence, branding, and go-to-market strategy for our holding company and its products.

We are builders and operators first and foremost, and are building a variety of products (learn more at https://blog.anagram.xyz/).

You’ll play a pivotal role in introducing our products to the world, and building a strong community, brand and userbase for them. This role requires a deep understanding of crypto trends, user behavior, and the ability to translate complex features into clear, compelling messaging.

Responsibilities

  • Brand: Review, develop, and manage brand identity and strategy for Anagram and the products that it builds

  • Comms: Manage comms for Anagram, as well as for products that Anagram launches

  • Go-to-Market (GTM): Plan and execute GTM strategies for new products Anagram builds

  • Positioning & Messaging: Develop compelling positioning, and value propositions for different audiences (e.g., developers, retail users, institutions).

  • Content & Collateral: Take ownership of creating core marketing assets including product explainers, website copy, one-pagers, blog posts, X posts, and presentations.

  • Analytics & Optimization: Track performance of product marketing campaigns and optimize for reach, engagement, and conversion.

Requirements

  • Diverse and generalist skill set focused on product marketing - with ability to manage broader marketing, comms, and brand

  • 3+ years of product marketing experience ideally at a crypto-native company.

  • Deep understanding of the crypto technology, and ecosystems, with personal or professional experience using crypto-native products. Strong grasp on the unique nature of Product Marketing in the crypto industry.

  • Experience working across the full marketing funnel — from awareness to retention.

  • Familiarity with community platforms (e.g., Discord, Telegram, X/Twitter).

  • Strong storytelling and copywriting skills with an eye for detail.

  • Self-starter who thrives in fast-paced, remote environments.

  • Ability to work on multiple different products in parallel.

Why Join Anagram?

  • Innovation at the Forefront: Work on a product that is breaking new ground in the crypto/DeFi space, with challenges and opportunities that are truly one-of-a-kind.

  • Comprehensive Exposure: Gain hands-on experience with every layer of the crypto/DeFi stack, from infrastructure to UX.

  • Dynamic Team Environment: Be part of a team that values radical thinking, open-mindedness, and relentless pursuit of excellence in a fun and collaborative environment.

jobs.title: Defi Researcher
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Anagram is a digital assets holding company where we build and incubate new crypto projects.


MISSION

Build and accelerate decentralized technology to reorder our economies into communities of distributed and individual ownership


VALUES

At Anagram we play, build, and win as a team. We like to have fun while we relentlessly pursue excellence in everything we do. We are entrepreneurs first, thinking radically outside the box, creatively and futuristically. We are working hard to re-order the world while focusing on sincere open-mindedness, curiosity and radical transparency.


THESIS

More and more people will continue to enter the digital asset ecosystem.

All existing assets will be digitized and new assets will be created.

Digitized assets will become financialized and interoperable.

Web3 will enable open access to all modern and future forms of finance.

Anyone, anywhere, will be able to create financial products.

Through active participation, Anagram is committed to accelerating the digital financialization of everything and enabling everyone to participate in the digital asset ecosystem.

Looking forward to working together!


If this isn't the right fit, we are hiring across a number of roles and would be happy to consider your candidacy. Feel free to email your resume to recruiting@anagram.xyz

jobs.title: Founding Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Who is Anagram?
Anagram is a digital assets holding company focused on building and incubating innovative crypto projects. Our mission is to accelerate the development of decentralized technology that transforms economies into communities of distributed and individual ownership. At Anagram, we believe in playing, building, and winning as a team, with a focus on radical thinking, creativity, and a commitment to excellence. We are passionate entrepreneurs, committed to reordering the world through sincere open-mindedness, curiosity, and radical transparency.


What are we hiring for?
We are seeking a Founding Engineer to join our team and play a crucial role in the development of Glider.fi, one of our most ambitious projects. Glider.fi is a groundbreaking product in the decentralized finance (DeFi) space, designed to offer innovative solutions that have never been attempted on-chain before. As a Founding Engineer, you will be responsible for building end-to-end features, working with cutting-edge technology, and contributing to a product that uses every piece of the crypto/DeFi stack.

Key Responsibilities:

  • End-to-End Development: Lead the design and development of comprehensive features for the Glider.fi flagship product, ensuring they are scalable, secure, and efficient.

  • Innovative Problem Solving: Tackle unique challenges related to declarative trading and vertical solutions, bringing creative and well-architected approaches to complex problems.

  • Full-Stack Collaboration: Engage with every layer of the crypto/DeFi stack, from backend infrastructure to on-chain swaps and frontend Web3 UX, ensuring seamless integration and functionality.

Qualifications:

  • Experience: 5+ years of experience in software engineering, with a focus on full-stack development and a deep understanding of both frontend and backend technologies.

  • Tech Stack Proficiency:

  • Frontend: Expertise in Next.js, tRPC, TypeScript, Tailwind + Radix UI, Zustand, react-spring, Vitest & Synpress.

  • Web3: Familiarity with Viem/Wagmi, permissionless.js/pimlico, SIWE (Sign-In with Ethereum), ZeroDev Kernel Smart Accounts.

  • Backend: Strong skills in Node.js (TypeScript), MySQL/Drizzle, Axiom & Sentry, with the ability to work with Python-based solvers.

  • Problem-Solving Skills: Proven ability to design and implement novel solutions in a fast-paced, innovative environment.

  • Passion for Crypto: A deep interest in the crypto and decentralized finance ecosystem, with a strong desire to push the boundaries of what is possible on-chain.

Why Join Anagram?

  • Innovation at the Forefront: Work on a product that is breaking new ground in the crypto/DeFi space, with challenges and opportunities that are truly one-of-a-kind.

  • Comprehensive Exposure: Gain hands-on experience with every layer of the crypto/DeFi stack, from infrastructure to UX.

  • Dynamic Team Environment: Be part of a team that values radical thinking, open-mindedness, and relentless pursuit of excellence in a fun and collaborative environment.

jobs.title: Site Reliability Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) – Web3 Infrastructure

📍 Remote, Hybrid, or In-Office (Location Flexible)

Who We Are

Anagram is a digital assets holding company investing in and incubating innovative crypto projects. Our portfolio companies span multiple blockchain ecosystems, pushing the boundaries of decentralized technology. We are seeking a Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) to support and scale critical infrastructure across our ventures.

The Role

As an SRE, you will ensure the reliability, security, and performance of backend systems, establishing best practices in DevOps, observability, and CI/CD. You will work closely with development teams to deploy code, automate processes, and maintain high-availability distributed systems.

Key Responsibilities

  • Infrastructure as Code (IaC): Design and implement scalable infrastructure using Terraform, Kubernetes, and containerized environments.

  • Reliability & Observability: Develop monitoring, logging, and alerting solutions to maintain system health and minimize downtime.

  • CI/CD & Automation: Build and optimize CI/CD pipelines, ensuring efficient deployment of backend services and smart contracts.

  • Performance Tuning: Identify and resolve bottlenecks in distributed systems to improve scalability and efficiency.

  • Security Best Practices: Implement and enforce security policies, including key management, access controls, and network security.

Preferred Qualifications

  • 4+ years of experience in DevOps, SRE, or Backend Engineering roles.

  • Strong coding skills in Python, Go, Rust, or Bash for automation and tooling.

  • Experience with cloud-native environments (AWS, GCP, Azure) and container orchestration.

  • Expertise in blockchain node infrastructure (e.g., Ethereum, Solana, Cosmos) is a plus.

  • Familiarity with Web3 security considerations and best practices for smart contract deployments.

Why Join?

  • Work on cutting-edge crypto infrastructure and decentralized systems.

  • Choose your work style: Remote, Hybrid, or In-Office based on your preference.

  • Collaborate with top-tier engineers in fast-moving, high-impact environments across various blockchain ecosystems.

jobs.title: Senior Backend & Smart Contract Engineer (Rust/Solana)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Breeze, we’re building the modern infrastructure for earning yield on digital assets — a seamless, non-custodial platform integrated directly into the apps users already love.

Our philosophy is simple: build fast, validate quickly, double down on the things users love, and kill the ones that don’t deserve to live.

You are the right candidate if you care deeply about users, enjoy working close to metal on chain-level systems, and love getting scrappy to build 0→1. At Breeze, the backend is the product — from our risk engine and fund accounting to our Solana programs powering seamless, non-custodial yield.

What you’ll do

  • Design and implement Solana smart contracts in Rust for our core yield platform, managing funds, shares, and on-chain routing logic.

  • Extend and maintain backend systems — indexers, risk engines, and real-time fund analytics — ensuring they are performant and reliable at scale.

  • Work across the stack to integrate backend logic with our API and SDKs, surfacing clean interfaces to frontend developers and integration partners.

  • Push our product experiments forward by quickly validating ideas and iterating based on user and partner feedback.

  • Collaborate with fullstack engineers and product teams to deliver a world-class developer and user experience.

Requirements

  • Humble and hungry senior-level engineer with 5+ years of experience and exceptional technical skills in your domain.

  • Deep experience building and shipping Rust-based smart contracts on Solana.

  • Demonstrated ability to lead medium-to-large scope backend and protocol engineering projects.

  • Strong understanding of DeFi primitives (staking, lending, AMMs) and experience building crypto products.

  • Proven track record of delivering in fast-paced, iterative environments and finding product-market fit.

Comfort working across engineering domains and thinking about the full product experience.

jobs.title: Staff Backend Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Who is Anagram?

Anagram is a digital assets holding company focused on building and incubating innovative crypto projects. Our mission is to accelerate the development of decentralized technology that transforms economies into communities of distributed and individual ownership. At Anagram, we believe in playing, building, and winning as a team, with a focus on radical thinking, creativity, and a commitment to excellence. We are passionate entrepreneurs, committed to reordering the world through sincere open-mindedness, curiosity, and radical transparency.

What is Glider?

Glider.fi is a groundbreaking product in the decentralized finance (DeFi) space, designed to offer innovative solutions that have never been attempted on-chain before. Glider enables users to build, test, and automate non-custodial trading strategies on-chain. We are at the forefront of crypto trading development: intents, chain abstraction, verification, solvers, etc.

What are we hiring for?

We are seeking a Staff Backend Engineer to join our team and play a crucial role in the development of Glider.fi, one of our most ambitious projects. As a Staff Backend Engineer, you will be responsible for building novel data models for crypto trading, working with cutting-edge technology, and contributing to a product that uses every piece of the crypto/DeFi stack.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Backend Development: Design, develop, and maintain scalable backend systems using Node.js (TypeScript), MySQL/Drizzle, Axiom, and Sentry to support the evolving needs of Glider’s platform.

  • Data-Driven Decision Making: Help structure and optimize Glider’s data models while contributing to liquidity analysis, PNL optimization, and performance monitoring.

  • Time-Series Monitoring: Implement and maintain time-series-based monitoring systems to track and analyze trading strategies, performance, and liquidity.

  • Dive Deep into Solvers: Work closely with python-based solvers and verifier networks to enhance strategy execution and ensure safe, efficient rebalancing of portfolios.

  • Problem-Solving and Innovation: Solve complex technical challenges in a fast-paced, innovative environment while continuously pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in DeFi.

Qualifications:

  • Experience: 5+ years of experience in backend software engineering with a strong understanding of data systems, crypto trading, and performance monitoring.

  • Tech Stack Proficiency:

    • Strong expertise in Node.js (TypeScript), MySQL, Python

    • Experience with time-series-based monitoring, liquidity analysis, and PNL optimization

    • Familiarity with Verifier Networks like Eigenlayer

    • Proficient in data modeling within the trading domain (ie schemas for Glider’s block strategies)

    • Proven ability to design and implement novel solutions in a dynamic and rapidly evolving environment.

  • Data Expertise: A strong believer in data-based decision-making, with the ability to structure and analyze complex data models.

  • Passion for Crypto: A deep interest in the cryptocurrency and decentralized finance ecosystem, with a desire to explore and expand what is possible on-chain.

Why Join Glider?

  • Innovate in DeFi: Work on a product that is transforming decentralized finance with innovative and data-driven solutions.

  • Hands-On Exposure: Be deeply involved in all aspects of crypto and DeFi development, building and using novel infrastructure

  • Collaborative Environment: Join a passionate and innovative team where radical thinking and open-mindedness drive success.

  • Extensive Benefits:

    • Health/Dental/Vision Insurance

    • Unlimited PTO

    • Home Office Stipend

    • Monthly Wifi + Cell + ChatGPT Stipend

This is your chance to be part of an industry-defining project at the intersection of cryptocurrency, blockchain data, and financial technology.

We are at the forefront of crypto trading development: intents, chain abstraction, verification, solvers, etc.

What are we hiring for?

We are seeking a Staff Backend Engineer to join our team and play a crucial role in the development of Glider.fi http://Glider.fi, one of our most ambitious projects. As a Staff Backend Engineer, you will be responsible for building novel data models for crypto trading, working with cutting-edge technology, and contributing to a product that uses every piece of the crypto/DeFi stack.

Key Responsibilities:

 - Backend Development: Design, develop, and maintain scalable backend systems using Node.js (TypeScript), MySQL/Drizzle, Axiom, and Sentry to support the evolving needs of Glider’s platform.

 - Data-Driven Decision Making: Help structure and optimize Glider’s data models while contributing to liquidity analysis, PNL optimization, and performance monitoring.

 - Time-Series Monitoring: Implement and maintain time-series-based monitoring systems to track and analyze trading strategies, performance, and liquidity.

 - Dive Deep into Solvers: Work closely with python-based solvers and verifier networks to enhance strategy execution and ensure safe, efficient rebalancing of portfolios.

 - Problem-Solving and Innovation: Solve complex technical challenges in a fast-paced, innovative environment while continuously pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in DeFi.

Qualifications:

 - Experience: 5+ years of experience in backend software engineering with a strong understanding of data systems, crypto trading, and performance monitoring.

 - Tech Stack Proficiency:
   
   - Strong expertise in Node.js (TypeScript), MySQL, Python
   
   - Experience with time-series-based monitoring, liquidity analysis, and PNL optimization
   
   - Familiarity with Verifier Networks like Eigenlayer
   
   - Proficient in data modeling within the trading domain (ie schemas for Glider’s block strategies)
   
   - Proven ability to design and implement novel solutions in a dynamic and rapidly evolving environment.

 - Data Expertise: A strong believer in data-based decision-making, with the ability to structure and analyze complex data models.

 - Passion for Crypto: A deep interest in the cryptocurrency and decentralized finance ecosystem, with a desire to explore and expand what is possible on-chain.

Why Join Glider?

 - Innovate in DeFi: Work on a product that is transforming decentralized finance with innovative and data-driven solutions.

 - Hands-On Exposure: Be deeply involved in all aspects of crypto and DeFi development, building and using novel infrastructure

 - Collaborative Environment: Join a passionate and innovative team where radical thinking and open-mindedness drive success.

 - Extensive Benefits:
   
   - Health/Dental/Vision Insurance
   
   - Unlimited PTO
   
   - Home Office Stipend
   
   - Monthly Wifi + Cell + ChatGPT Stipend

This is your chance to be part of an industry-defining project at the intersection of cryptocurrency, blockchain data, and financial technology.

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Breeze, we’re building the modern infrastructure for earning yield on digital assets — and making it seamless for developers and users to access through beautiful, intuitive interfaces.

We believe in validating quickly: build it, ship it, and see how users respond. If they love it, we double down. If not, we move on.

You are the right candidate if you thrive at the intersection of frontend and backend, love to craft user-centric experiences, and want to bring the power of Breeze’s risk-managed yield platform to life for developers and end users alike.

What you’ll do

  • Build and maintain the Breeze UI toolkit and admin portal, enabling integration partners to deliver branded, composable, protocol-aware user experiences.

  • Develop seamless, responsive interfaces that surface Breeze’s real-time fund data, risk metrics, and user-level yield tracking.

  • Integrate with our Solana-based backend and SDKs, translating complex on-chain state into clear, actionable UX.

  • Collaborate with backend and smart contract engineers to define clean APIs and improve developer ergonomics.

  • Prototype and iterate on new product experiments to test with users and partners.

Requirements

  • Humble and hungry senior-level engineer with 5+ years of experience and very strong fullstack skills.

  • Demonstrated ability to ship fullstack products from 0→1 that have found product-market fit.

  • Experience leading medium-to-large scope projects and working across engineering domains.

  • Expertise in React (or similar frameworks), TypeScript, modern CSS, and backend integration.

  • Familiarity with Solana or other blockchain platforms and experience building crypto products.

  • Strong product sense and conviction for building interfaces that users actually love to use.

jobs.title: Founding Engineer : SWIG
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Swig📗

Swig is building the future of onchain wallets.

Swig is a smart wallet-as-a-service platform that radically simplifies how developers and users interact with blockchains. Built from first principles for an onchain world, Swig combines account abstraction, granular permissions, and flexible identity attestation into a native wallet architecture—no centralized infrastructure, no hidden trade-offs.

Where legacy wallet providers rely on off-chain systems, Swig puts core logic onchain by default, ensuring composability, resilience, and trustless design at every layer. Features like multi-wallet delegation, session keys, and automated transactions come baked in—making powerful wallet experiences easy to build and seamless to use.

Swig gives developers the tools to build secure, flexible wallets that feel simple and intuitive—without sacrificing control. We believe wallets should be invisible until they matter. Swig is how we get there.

What you’ll do 🚀

As an early engineer, you will be tasked with owning the technical development of the Swig stack. You’ll have end-to-end responsibility over the entire Swig architecture, which includes the core Swig protocol, our rust/typescript SDKs, smart contracts, identity services, and web UIs.

The core Swig protocol is open source at its core. Therefore, you must be comfortable developing concurrent open source and managed services.

This is a high-growth role where you’ll partner closely with the CEO on product strategy, GTM, and business development. You will play a critical role in shaping the culture of our engineering organization and the company as a whole.

Key Responsibilities

  • Completely own the Swig stack end-to-end, which includes: the core Swig protocol, its SDKs, key services (i.e. identity provisioning), and web UIs

  • Maintaining Swig’s services, which includes coordinating audits for critical deploys and holding a strong quality bar for development quality

  • Writing backend/client code and smart contracts for new features

  • Acting as a key business development participant in technical conversations with potential partners

  • Serving as the defacto engineering voice of the Swig org

  • Being a close partner with the CEO on subsequent engineering hiring and constructing the culture of the engineering organization

You’ll be successful if…

  • You’re a full-stack IC at heart with a true player/coach mentality

  • You have a deep sense of product craft. You maintain an ultra-high quality bar with a deep appreciation for intuitive, simple, and beautiful consumer and b2b products.

  • You have an extreme bias for action. When you spot bugs you don’t push them to the backlog or wait until a future sprint to squash them; you just fix them.

  • You think in terms of systems, not features. You can peer far into the future. With this super power, you see how the pieces fit together and you plan accordingly for scalable services that will limit tech debt, large rewrites, and promote a culture of modularity.

  • You are an incredible, n-of-1 verbal and written communicator. You get to the point with succinct, data-based articulation. You prioritize quick communication with your stakeholders as needed

  • Your default mode is to ‘act as an owner’. You have a high degree of personal accountability and bias to problem solve collaboratively even if it requires working outside normal hours. When there is a problem, you attack it ferociously until it is resolved. The word ‘ambiguity’ fires you up.

  • You have strong opinions, loosely held. You come to the table with a perspective, but appreciate that you may be wrong and truth-seek from first principles until a root cause is found. You believe that listening is sometimes better than speaking.

  • You have a demonstrated history of building systems, SDKs, and dynamic infra services at scale

  • You are an expert in SVM/EVM (web3.js and solana sdk 2.0)

  • You have experience managing complex zk infrastrucutre

  • You’ve built an integration related to money movement. You have expertise in funds ledgering, settlement, and recons.

  • Must-have proficiencies: rust, typescript, react, next.js, node.js, typescript, css, shell

  • You have prior direct management experience

Follow Us 👀

  • https://x.com/onswig

  • https://build.onswig.com/
